address: Xã Tà Hừa, Huyện Than Uyên, Tỉnh Lai Châu
thought:
**My Analysis of the Address Mapping**

Okay, so I'm tackling this Vietnamese address mapping, trying to figure out how "Xã Tà Hừa, Huyện Than Uyên, Tỉnh Lai Châu" corresponds to the new administrative structure. My first step is to break down the old address: I've got "Xã Tà Hừa" as the old ward, "Huyện Than Uyên" as the old district (though, as the prompt specifies, districts are being eliminated, so this is just for context), and "Tỉnh Lai Châu" as the old province.

Next, I need to check the relevant resolutions. I immediately look at Resolution 60-NQ/TW to see if anything changes with the province. Thankfully, "Tỉnh Lai Châu" is listed under "Các đơn vị hành chính cấp tỉnh không thực hiện sáp nhập," so I know the province remains unchanged. That makes things a bit easier.

Now, I move on to Resolution 1670/NQ-UBTVQH15, since it directly deals with rearranging ward-level units in Lai Châu.  Bingo! Line 1 of that resolution is the key. It clearly states that "Xã Tà Hừa" is being merged with other wards into a new ward called "**Xã Mường Kim**".  I note that "Xã Tà Hừa" doesn't factor into any of the other resolutions.

With that confirmed, I check my "New Wards" data.  I look for "Xã Mường Kim" within "Tỉnh Lai Châu."  The data matches, confirming that the new ward is indeed "Xã Mường Kim," with the code "03637."

Given the explicit mention in the resolution, and the data validation, my confidence in this mapping is very high. I'm ready to construct the JSON output reflecting this confirmed mapping.

citation.header: 1670/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lai Châu
citation.line: 1. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Tà Mung, Tà Hừa, Pha Mu và Mường Kim thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Mường Kim.
